responsibilities: Design and develop electrical systems for camera hardware, including PCBs, power management, and sensor integration.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of cameras with other hardware and software components.
Perform functional, performance, and environmental testing on camera systems to validate designs.
Debug and troubleshoot electrical issues, including power supply, signal integrity, and EMI/EMC concerns.
Develop test setups and procedures to validate hardware performance and compliance with industry standards.
Optimize electrical designs for manufacturability, reliability, and cost efficiency.
Document designs, test results, and troubleshooting processes to support product development and manufacturing.
category: Prompt Engineering and Large Language Models (LLMs)
activity: Fine-tuning and customization of language models
analysis: The job responsibilities focus on designing and developing electrical systems for camera hardware, including tasks like PCB design, power management, sensor integration, testing, debugging, and documentation. These responsibilities are centered around hardware engineering and do not involve any tasks related to language models or their customization. Therefore, fine-tuning and customization of language models is not relevant to the job responsibilities.
